Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2014 11:49PM crystalh wrote: Halaven for me too.  Just started 2nd cycle today.  Two weeks on and one week off.  My hair grew back on Xeloda (which gave me a 6 month run and then the liver lit up with more mets and more activity in old mets).  My hair started falling out exactly 2 weeks after starting Halaven.  On the good side, I am no longer suffering from hand/foot syndrome caused by Xeloda.   My blood counts are good, energy is up, and I am back to exercising again.  WooHoo!  I do have a bad rash on the right side of my abdomen that appears to be a side effect of Halaven (for less than 10% on the drug).  Treating with hydrocortisone cream and Benadryl.  Please keep your updates coming about Halaven.  I'm getting nervous after rolling through Ixempra and Xeloda so quickly.  Taxol/Avastin gave me 3 years NED!  Looking for another long run...  :-)
Posts.Title: Halaven anyone? JimmieBell Roddy-Brazil

Posts.Content: Jul 18, 2013 08:04PM crystalh wrote: You are always in my prayers! ((Hugs)). Wishing you a successful surgery on your birthday and many more happy years ahead. So sorry that you have hit this rough patch. I just keep picturing you climbing that mountain. You are strong and such an inspiration to everyone who meets you. Looking forward to your update after the surgery... Letting us know that you have knocked out yet another obstacle in your path.

Posts.Title: Bye bye Navelbine, hello Gemzar nancyh crystalh

Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2012 11:53PM crystalh wrote: I have been on taxol/avastin for almost 2 years now with NED.  A friend of mine was on abraxane/avastin for similar amount of time until disease progression.  She is now on xeloda/avastin and doing good with disease regression past two scans.  Wishing you much success with your new treatment plans.  There are many different drug combos.  Praying you will receive the right one for you!
Posts.Title: Carbo/Taxol People: Question FiveAlive FiveAlive

Posts.Content: crystalh wrote: Anyone have feedback on Ixempra in combination with Avastin? I will be starting it on Tues. I had previously been on Taxol and Avastin, but had to take a break from Avastin in December. I now have new liver mets. Looking for others who have had success with this combination!
